summary: acute chest syndrome (ACS) is the main cause of mortality among patients with sickle cell disease (SCD), one of the most frequent monogenic diseases. ACS associates fever and respiratory symptoms (including cough, dyspnea/acute respiratory failure, and chest pain) to new pulmonary infiltrates. prospective study in patients with ACS aims at studying relationship between regional lung structure, as assessed by density, and lung metabolism.
